p: The great structural similarity between SARS-CoV-2 and betacoronaviruses brings the hypothesis that SARS-CoV-2 also possesses similar neurotrophic and neuro-invasive properties. Furthermore, SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 use the same host receptor, the human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) [ 53]. It is proposed that the virus enter the CNS through different routes including the olfactory and trigeminal nerves, the cerebrospinal fluid, the vasculature, and the lymphatic system [ 54].
